title: Jägermeister
summary: Jägermeister (/ˈjeɪɡərmaɪstər/ YAY-gər-my-stər, German: [ˈjɛːɡɐˌmaɪstɐ] (listen); stylized Jägermeiſter)[lower-alpha 1] is a German digestif[1] made with 56 herbs and spices. Developed in 1934 by Wilhelm and Curt Mast,[2][3] it has an alcohol by volume of 35% (61 degrees proof, or US 70 proof). The recipe has not changed since its creation[4] and continues to be served in its signature green glass bottle.[5] It is the flagship product of Mast-Jägermeister SE headquartered in Wolfenbüttel, Germany.
